articles.headline: Moving Downtown: AOL Seeks New Image
articles.snippet: AOL will move its headquarters from Dulles, Va., next spring as it tries to retool itself as an advertising company that competes with the likes of Google, Yahoo and Microsoft.
articles.abstract: AOL will move its headquarters from Dulles, Va., next spring as it tries to retool itself as an advertising company that competes with the likes of Google, Yahoo and Microsoft.
articles.lead_paragraph: IT’S not a literal move to Madison Avenue, but it’s close.

articles.headline: In Europe, Some Toy Makers Shun the China Label
articles.snippet: With the American toy industry reeling from recalls of millions of Chinese-made toys, some of Europe’s best-known toy makers find themselves in a fortuitous position.
articles.abstract: With the American toy industry reeling from recalls of millions of Chinese-made toys, some of Europe’s best-known toy makers find themselves in a fortuitous position.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Sept. 17 — Playmobil of Germany has long promoted its colorful plastic pirates, firefighters and farm animals as better-than-your-average plaything — toys to be handed down rather than chewed up. Now it can add another selling point: they are made in Europe, not China.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Ivar Ekman

articles.headline: Microsoft Ruling May Bode Ill for Other Companies
articles.snippet: Experts said a European antitrust ruling might signal problems for companies like Apple, Intel and Qualcomm.
articles.abstract: Experts said a European antitrust ruling might signal problems for companies like Apple, Intel and Qualcomm.
articles.lead_paragraph: LUXEMBOURG, Sept. 17 — Europe’s second-highest court delivered a stinging rebuke to Microsoft Monday, but the impact of the decision upholding an earlier antitrust ruling may extend well beyond the world’s largest software maker to other high-technology companies.
articles.byline: By Kevin J. O'Brien and Steve Lohr

articles.headline: Wary of Past, Clinton Unveils a Health Plan
articles.snippet: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton released a plan for universal health coverage designed to avoid the political flaws in her failed proposal of 1993-94.
articles.abstract: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton released a plan for universal health coverage designed to avoid the political flaws in her failed proposal of 1993-94.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES, Sept. 17 — Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton unveiled a plan on Monday to guarantee health insurance to all Americans, but in a way carefully designed to avoid the political flaws in her failed proposal of 1993-94.
articles.byline: By Patrick Healy and Robin Toner

articles.headline: Lawyer Will Plead Guilty in Kickback Scheme
articles.snippet: Under a plea deal,  William S. Lerach may face up to two years in prison.
articles.abstract: Under a plea deal,  William S. Lerach may face up to two years in prison.
articles.lead_paragraph: The securities lawyer William S. Lerach agreed to plead guilty today to a criminal conspiracy charge in connection with a class-action scheme involving his former firm, now known as Milberg Weiss, the United States attorney’s office in Los Angeles said.

articles.headline: MySpace to Discuss Effort to Customize Ads
articles.snippet: The social network site says it can tailor ads to the personal information that its users leave on their pages.
articles.abstract: The social network site says it can tailor ads to the personal information that its users leave on their pages.
articles.lead_paragraph: Members of the booming social network Web sites treat their individual profile pages as a creative canvas for personal expression.

articles.headline: U.S. Contractor Banned by Iraq Over Shootings
articles.snippet: Baghdad’s authority to bar Blackwater USA, a security company that was involved in the deaths of eight Iraqis, appeared to be in question.
articles.abstract: Baghdad’s authority to bar Blackwater USA, a security company that was involved in the deaths of eight Iraqis, appeared to be in question.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Tuesday, Sept. 18 — Blackwater USA, an American contractor that provides security to some of the top American officials in Iraq, has been banned from working in the country by the Iraqi government after a shooting that left eight Iraqis dead and involved an American diplomatic convoy.

articles.headline: Debt Market Looks to Fed to Restore Confidence
articles.snippet:
Investors assume that the central bank will reduce the overnight federal funds rate by at least a quarter of a percentage point, to 5 percent.

But many market analysts say that will not be enough to restore confidence.
articles.abstract:
Investors assume that the central bank will reduce the overnight federal funds rate by at least a quarter of a percentage point, to 5 percent.

But many market analysts say that will not be enough to restore confidence.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lou Gervolino, a business executive from the San Francisco area, watched mortgage rates climb last month when he looked to refinance a jumbo home loan.
